meanings.definition: A type of wallboard made of gypsum plaster and covered with paper
meanings.sent1: The sheetrock was used to build the walls in the new house.
meanings.sent2: The workers installed the sheetrock to create smooth walls.
meanings.sent3: When the sheetrock fell, it made a big mess!
meanings.sent4: The sheetrock was like a blank canvas waiting to be painted.
meanings.sent5: The sheetrock absorbed the paint, transforming the room.

meanings.sent1: They will sheetrock the walls to give them a finished look.
meanings.sent2: The contractor sheetrocked the entire room in just one day.
meanings.sent3: I sheetrocked the ceiling upside down by mistake!
meanings.sent4: The sheetrocking process made the room feel brand new.
meanings.sent5: He sheetrocked the old wall, making it sturdy and smooth.

meanings.definition: A piece of sheetrock used for construction or repair
meanings.sent1: The worker carried a heavy sheetrock to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: We need to buy more sheetrock for the repairs in the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat used the sheetrock as a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The sheetrock became a crucial part of the renovation project.
meanings.sent5: The sheetrock was the missing piece needed to complete the wall.
